intro: Caraguata schlumbergeri, commonly known as the Schleumberger cactus, is a species of flowering cactus native to South America. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems that are segmented and covered in spines. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers during the warmer months. It is a succulent, capable of storing water in its stems, making it drought-tolerant. Its unique appearance and ability to thrive in arid conditions make it a popular choice for cactus enthusiasts.
